I presume at least this area, the production staff tried at least a teeny-weeny effort for them to stand out, and they did, albeit for their screen-time moments.


Error No. 3: Art and animation sucks balls...HARD enough to crash and burn.

EMT Squared is a newcomer studio, but that doesn't mean that you have ALL authority to give them this project to handle...and it shows and reflects very badly from start to end. Action sequences are off with the wrong camera focuses and the many stills; character designs are super-off and deformed in terms of body and faces (especially one-sided faces where the designers super-cheaped-out and cut out on drawing 1 eye instead of both), not to mention the stale background art and obsolete animation quality.


Error No. 4: Forget about the music aesthetics, they are the worst in terms of representation.

I absolutely despise the sound choices done here, nothing here is ever noteworthy, so don't get me started...except I'm doing that now. The OST is horrible, sound effects at the level of LOLs and hilariously-unfunny bad placements.


We all never once thought there could be any other anime that will be scraping the bottom of the barrel, but this anime proved us wrong. Bland. boring, cliché, flat, tiresome, you name it, this anime has it all. Whatever it is, this anime is an outright waste-barrel of an excuse of time, talents and effort, and should be shunned and abstained at all costs.

The Master of Ragnarok & Blesser of Einherjar or as I like to call it The Master of Rock Bottom is garbage. This is what happens when a studio named Em2 copies and pastes the world most uninspired Iseaki anime (In Another World With My Smartphone). With writing, direction and production so bad it makes shows like Black Clover and Darling in the Franxx look competent. The Master of Ragnarok & Blesser of Einherjar is empty filled of nothingness that can't even respect its own target audience correctly. The show itself is horrendously written crap in the very beginning with numerous red flags popping up overthe course of it that would quickly lead to series killing problems.


Now with that said let's begin with the broken mess.


Story.

Yuuto Suoh is a normal high school student who is knowledgeable about urban legends. In order to prove one of these legends, he and his childhood friend Mitsuki Shimoya visit a local shrine nearby. However, while using his smartphone to take a picture of himself next to the shrine's divine mirror, he finds himself mysteriously transported to another world called Yggdrasil.

This new world he arrives in is heavily steeped in Norse mythology. He also finds that many people fight each other over land domination. Yuuto is later taken in by the so-called Wolf Clan, a group of people with weak military tactics. Using the knowledge of military tactics he gained from school and his smartphone, he gradually makes the Wolf Clan rise to prominence. In turn, he also gains the affection of a group of magic-wielding warrior maidens known as the Einherjar.

Am just going to say this right now the story is a complete dumpster fire.

Right out the gate, this show makes a horrendous first impression where the show starts off with our protagonist already in the fantasy world for two years. We the viewer barely know jack shit about protagonist time from the last 2 years minus that terrible backstory that shows us how he got transported in the word.

The Master Of Rock Bottom is a horrendously written harem disguised as Iseaki anime that follows every single generic story elements that we all seen before from this genre. male protagonist gets send to the generic fantasy land by accident. A bunch of girls from all types of fetishes and tropes come up to surround the main protagonist cock forming a harem in the process. The main protagonist becomes the strongest person in a set country by dethroning every single competent faction with no issues whatsoever.

Honestly, if you have seen In Another World With My Smartphone as well any other bad Isekai anime then you seen The Master Of Rock Bottom because not only it took everything that was wrong about those bad Isekai anime but this show somehow manages to make they worse to a point where it actually becomes downright insufferable to watch as you constantly shoving its true intentions right down our fucking throats.

Overall the story in The Master of Rock Bottom is absolutely rotten garbage. 

0.5/10


Chararters. 

It's honestly hard to call the chararters in The Master of Rock Bottom actual characters because every single and I mean every single character are a bunch of trophy pandering husks as they all only exist to please a certain type of audience not much beyond that.

Our main protagonist Yuuto is a generic and uninspired husk who barely has the capable of being an actual protagonist. His motivation is paper fin as we know jack shit about his earth life and his personality as an interesting as a potato.

The female characters aka Yuuto fetish harem are somehow even worse. Every single female character in this show only has a single character trait and not much beyond that.

The same thing can apply for side characters and villains.

Overall the characters are complete abominations.

1/10


Visuals.

Saying that The Master Of Rock Bottom looks like garbage is a fast understatement. This is by far the absolute worst looking show I have ever experience from this decade. Black Clover, Beatless and Darling in the Franxx my have horrible production values but least tired to good every now and then this rabbit hole show doesn't even give a damm about looking good. The character designs all atrocious bad as all ugly to look at as they every single character look like they came from DeviantArt in the year 2001. Not to mention all of the female characters are oversexualized to the core meaning throughout this show you will see lolis doing sexual acts left and right.

The actual animation is hot garbage. Choppy movement left and right, horrendous fight choreography, abysmal use of CGI for the horses and soldiers. Budget cuts everywhere mixed with the shameful use of stock footage.


Now if you the show actual animation was horrendous the opening visuals are somehow even worse. It's is a normally for the anime industry to have opening visuals that look good in order to draw the viewer in but The Master of Rock Bottom can't even do that. Not only do the characters in the opening visuals constantly go off model but the way that the show was directed visually gives me an eyesore. The camerawork is almost as bad as Bubsy 3D on the PlayStation 1 and the way that the show showcased fight scenes in the opening was pure nonsense. How can a hammer red dude be able to move with the hammer like a freaking sword? I understand that training exists but at the same time but how can he be able to block fast sword attacks from that sword chick. In both real life and video games heavy weapons while despite being doing more damage to the foe has a pretty long reaction time cool time thanks to that weight of the hammer facing towards a certain leaving you wide open in the process for enemy fire while you're trying to control the weight of the set heavy weapon.

To add insult to injury in episode 11 the red dude is was able to spin the heavyweight hammer like a fucking shield without getting tried. That's not how hammers work...

Overall like with this story and characters the visuals are a complete dumpster fire.

0/10


Sound.

Just like with most bad Isekai anime that came before it, it's generic and boring Isekai music that we all see before. The same thing applies to both the opening and ending themes which they are uninspired as hell that is filled with crappy imagery.

While the soundtrack is generic the sound effects are downright horrible as they sound they just came straight from Berserk 2016. 

Now we get to the best part of the more like the final nail of the coffin being the voice acting for both the sub and dub.

The sub version is filled with boring and shitty performances where it feels like they are reading the show's script. I honestly feel bad for the Seiyus who had to voice characters in this scrapheap of an anime. Now if you thought the sub version was bad the dub version is somehow even worse. Not only the audio quality was abysmal beyond belief but the every single voice actor in the show sound like they were they were doing a fucking hentai production.

2/10


Final Thoughts.

This anime is a prime example of why I hate Isekai anime so much. It is a giant eyesore that makes Darling in the Franxx and Black Clover look like they were done by Hideaki Anno. The story, characters, voice acting, music, and the production values are absolutely horrendous beyond belief.


In my review of How to Not Summon a Demon Lord, I mentioned that I hated the Isekai genre as a whole and that show made hate despise the Isekai genre even more. Now after watching this rabbit hole of a show I officially lost all respect for Isekai genre as a whole to a point where I never want to touch an another modern Iseaki anime again.

Screw this show and screw everything that this anime stands for.

Final Score 0.5/10.

“I don’t think there’s a isekai worst than Sword Art Online”
Writer of MORBE: Hold my beer! 
I’m happy to announce to everyone who thought SAO was the worst isekai ever, that The Master of Ragnarok & Blesser of Einherjar (MORBE) has claimed that title. I have full confidence in saying that The Master of Ragnarok & Blesser of Einherjar is the worst isekai of all time. If someone made a list of everything wrong with a isekai light novel translated to an anime adaption then this would tick every box, that’s how laughably bad it is. 
Story- (1/10):
 This anime is very unique in its premise. Usuallyit starts with the protagonist getting inexplicably transported to a fantasy world, but this doesn’t even bother to start with that because who wants to see that again, amirte?! Your next thoughts are probably “we’ll get a proper introduction later on”, but NOPE it  doesn’t go back to explain it either!

When we’re introduced to the protagonist, he’s already been in this world for two years, so it’s like this doesn't classify as an Isekai.


There’s a ton of questions we’ll likely never know the answer to, for example:

- How the protagonist got transported to this world 

- What are the rules and intricacies that governs this world e.g. Why are their different clans? what they fighting for?

What’s more hilarious is the first episode attempts to cover this through exposition to explain how our protagonist got to his position of power, but it doesn’t explain shit. It just glosses over all the information and important details  


What a masterful deconstruction of an isekai anime! It has to be that or lazy writing which is why the story is so shallow and generic.

Seriously, the plot goes nowhere. The protagonist’s goal is to get back to his time period, but not really since he’s done nothing towards this 


Characters- (1/10):

Our protagonist is named Yuuto: a dense, self- insert harem protagonist who’s perfect in every way! He’s handsome, the leader of the Wolf Clan, adored by his devoted subjects, a military genius, the most morally just, and more importantly he has a harem of bitches at his beck and call! What more can you ask for in a MC?!


Honestly, Yuuto’s incredibly bland and severely lacking in character traits that i can’t even fathom why these girls swoon over him. They try to mention Yuuto’s flaw of being overconfident in the past which is why he’s frustrated and calls the red haired musclehead general a ‘baka’ all the time, but here’s the best part- we never see it! We never see Yuuto’s first experience coming into this world so we don’t know how naive and reckless he was or how he overcame it and become the humble beam of perfection we’ve come to know.   


So what makes Yuuto standout from your usual self-insert harem/Isekai protagonist? Well, Yuuto is unique in the stance that he claims girls as his property, and forces them to bend the knee to be part of his “family.” Yes, this sick perverted bastard makes these poor girls his sisters and daughters, and has them address him as “big brother” and “papa” to fulfill his incestial fantasies.


What else makes Yuuto great? Well he has a smartphone, but not just any ordinary one- a solar powered smartphone! Now our protagonist can search the web to look up military tactics from great historical leaders on Wikipedia to implement their strategies in battles, create advanced war technology and improve his clan with future inventions/concepts e.g. schools for education. 


Seriously, I don’t rate Yuuto at all because he isn’t exactly intelligent or strong, just a ordinary teenager with a deus ex machina smartphone. There’s nothing compelling about his character. At least Yuuto acknowledges he’s cheating and completely ordinary without it.


Let’s move on to the girls now. They are all so one dimensional, uninteresting, bland and can be described in a single sentence:


Felicia: Yuuto’s right hand girl (i’m shocked how I remember her name). Why does she have this role? I couldn’t tell you. She isn’t exactly intelligent or strong, just diplomatic and good at organising I guess. 


The other girls include: 

Pink haired horn clan imouto

Assassin Twins: one being a airhead and the other being a smartass

Grey haired, devoted swordsman girl  

Slave child girl who calls Yuuto “papa”

Tomboy blacksmith girl  


That’s literally all there is to them. 


Oh, let’s not forget Yuuto’s girl back home who isn’t actually his gf, but the childhood friend he loves and wants to return to. It’s such a poetic tale of how Yuuto has a harem of girls on his dick, but yet he’s still dreaming and fantasising about his unreachable girl that he’ll probably never see again xD


Another character is Felicia‘s brother. He’s a butthurt teen because their father picked Yuuto over him as his successor to the wolf clan, so he leaves to join another clan to seek revenge. He’s depicted as someone to rival Yuuto, but truly he stood no change against our lord and saviour! Felicia loves her “brother” Yuuto more than her real brother. Why does Felicia have such devotion to Yuuto over her real brother? No real reason. We don’t get to see how their relationship progressed and got so close.


Seriously, can someone break Yuuto’s smartphone already? I’m tired of seeing his irrelevant 5 min conversations every episode with the girl he likes. The conversations are always meaningless shit like a summary of how Yuuto’s day went. Mitsuki is so one dimensional it hurts. She has no depth, no screentime or relevancy to the actual story, so every time they talk I lose any immersion i have in this world. We don’t even see Yuuto and the girl’s relationship before he got transported into this world, hence why it’s so shallow and underdeveloped that I can’t be invested in them whatsoever. 


Animation- (1/10):

The animation’s trash. The CGI during fight scenes doesn’t even look like fights since the characters don’t even look like they’re hitting each other. There’s a lot of terribly animated still frames too. The battlefields, soldiers uniform and battle strategies aren’t detailed enough, there’s not enough focus on the troops to make it feel like they are at war. Plus, you can’t tell what strategies are being used properly due to the animation.


Sound- (1/10):

I can’t even remember the osts because I was too entranced in watching this masterpiece. Seriously, the OP, osts and endings are forgettable.


Enjoyment- (1/10):

I must be a masochist for pain because I hate this show with a burning passion, and regret every minute I spent watching this anime.  


Overall- (1/10);

The plot has gone nowhere thus far, the characters are painfully bland and annoying, we can’t get a semblance of plot progression without there being eechi fanservice scenes every 5 mins with girls pressing their boobs on Yuuto or literally taking off all their clothes and throwing themselves at him (I kid you not, this actually happened). I forced myself to watch this hoping for one redeemable quality, but I got nothing. The only reason I could recommend watching this is for the sole purpose of fapping to some soft incest hentai, or you’re watching to find out why it’s so bad and received negative reviews. Either way, it’s really not worth it.


PS: Can anyone point me towards where I can watch the prequel? Because it’s as if we’re missing a season’s worth of source material on Yuuto’s life with his childhood friend, the introduction of when he was transported into this world and his rise to power as the Wolf Clan’s leader in those 2 years. This anime had a couple of cool ideas e.g. the setting, the different clans etc, but the lack of content and poor execution destroyed any semblance of potential this might have had.

Dreadful....
Absolutely dreadful
I'm not sure where to even begin...I'm someone who loves this genre...I'll go as far as to even enjoy the isekai smart phone anime even if it's to just laugh at how terrible it is. But this anime is different.
Firstly we start off when the mc on the battle field. How did he get there? Idk. Why was he there? Idk. Unlike most isekais this anime starts off with the mc already in a different world. We have no idea how he got there, why he was there or why the mc is at the position that he is currently in(the anime tries toexplain it later on but does a poor job at it...)\n\n
I'd write more about this but I'd be wasting my time. I'll just give you my advice...dont waste your time....trust me it's not worth it. The fan service is alright for the series but like there are other anime that have better fan service. You shouldnt waste your time with something like this. The anime will bore you to death plus the world build is horrible. What makes isekai anime entertaining is the fact that we can see the world in the eyes of a character who is foreign to the world. Without proper world building no matter how many lolis and "oppai" you put into the series it will suck...and not in a good way. I cant even cringe watch this show smh...

"Those who are stupid are unaware of their own mistakes."
-ZARC, from Yu-Gi-Oh! Arc-V
Summer 2018 brought in some amazing shows like Isekai Maou, Cells At Work, Angels of Death, Overlord III, Revue Starlight, Banana Fish, SNK III, etc. However, it has had its equal share of mediocre to absolutely wasteful shows.
I really don’t think I need to make a long ass essay about how overused the isekai genre is in the recent years...that’s someone else’s job, honestly.
When people were saying Isekai Smartphone might have a second season, it's funny that this series came around not too long after. You know what? Here's this:
Some anonymous dude: "IsekaiSmartphone is the worst isekai series EVER."

This series: "HOLD MY GOD DAMN TEQUILA!"


This series pretty much does just about EVERYTHING wrong...not just as an isekai series, but as an anime show, in general. Even Ousama Game wasn't this stupid, cause at least that trash show had "reasonable" enjoyment value.


(some mild spoilers, btw)


STORY: 1/10

Okay, first off....why the actual hell do you start us off with our main guy already in the other world, and not only that, already in the middle of a battle?? Essentially we got no good siege-way for how the mc enters this Norse-inspired fantasy world called Yggdrasil. Apparently according to the LN, our dude basically took a selfie through his damn smartphone (which he later is SOMEHOW able to use in the fantasy world cause it's f***ing solar-powered), and gets zapped into this conundrum, and is somehow okay with it

The world-building is practically non-existent, and any explanations for certain points and aspects are scarce. Because of that, the core storyline is dull as hell...it doesn't deserve the description of "generic".

Unlike with Isekai Maou, this story doesn't handle the harem element very well. I can't be the only one uncomfortable with how the MC and his slowly growing harem address each other as family, right? Onii-san?? Aniki?? Father?? Regardless of what deep explanation I may get regarding this, it's just revolting, like an excuse for the guy to not bang the f*** out of any of the girls. I mean, at least he does choose someone at the end, but that childhood friend don't even deserve to be the one, let's be f***ing real, here.

The battles are not even enjoyable....they're awful. The so-called strategies during those clashes aren't even something worth raising your eyebrows at. I mean, the guy cheats off his damn phone, ffs!! 


ANIMATION AND SOUND: 1/10

Well how unfortunate....not even the soundtracks and the animation were any sort of "saving grace". None of the soundtracks are memorable, and honestly often very offputting. Personally, I love music, but I can be very distinct with my preferences of certain soundtracks and songs despite having  a diverse taste. When a series can't even make its music score half-decent, it's literally game over in my eyes.

The animation is honestly not the worst example I've seen, but it's still hella bad. Apparently the animation crew were either too lazy and/or heavily unmotivated. I'm just gonna stop there for that part.


CHARACTERS: 1/10

Ugh. Boring MC. Boring harem "squad". Boring "childhood friend". Boring side characters, too. Not even the god damn hot-blooded overpowered dude was good...I personally got sick of this dude's battle cries and pointless mid-battle chit-chats. The childhood friend, who got picked at the end, btw...is a previously pointless character who suddenly becomes relevant due to the aforementioned situation, which doesn't make any sense because she doesn't even spend even half as much time with the MC (even through phone calls....YES, somehow you can make phone calls between the real world and the fantasy world in this show, like WTF). So the harem our guy created became pointless, too.

I'm just saying, and for real...if this idiot won't have orgasm with any of our now-friendzoned Norse girls, they could've just went the yuri route with each other and the show would be easily half-decent.


ENJOYMENT: 1/10

I know I'm supposed to enjoy watching anime no matter what, and grade my stuff depending on how I felt about certain shows, especially in the character and enjoyment department. But with this series, watching it felt like that one household chore you absolutely despise doing, even though your mom and/or dad set a shitty ultimatum. Need I say how unenjoyable it was? Not gonna lie....half the time I was watching almost every episode, EXCEPT during the sexual advances by the girls (which were actually kinda amusing)....I'd be nearly dozing off or unconsciously reaching for my OWN smartphone to pay Tetris or send PMs. Why didn't I drop this series, you ask? Research reasons, simply put....basically information I can use in the future, should I become a writer or even be in the anime department one day...on what NOT to do when writing a story or adapting a series.


FINAL WORD: For the sake of your damn lives, people.....

DON'T. F***ING. WATCH. IT.

If you want actual decent or good isekai series, watch the likes of Re:Zero, Isekai Maou, No Game No Life, or Overlord instead. Even Sword Art Online, which is technically an isekai series in a way, is a masterpiece compared to THIS mess right here. As for me, while I did get helpful data (LMAO), I might be contemplating one day in the near future as to why I didn't drop it back then, and then probably break down and cry in deep regret, perhaps...LOL.


Y'all been warned, my fellow anime fans...

This show shouldn't be taken seriously. I saw many that gave this series a 1 out of pure hatred.  In my case however, I found amusement from this show.  While this show did a horrible job with its story and characters that cannot be fixed with Flex Tape, I had fun because of its poor quality.  
It was amusing to see how bad some of the actions scenes were and how pathetic some of the "heart warming" scenes were.  I was also pleased that they actually wrapped up the story.
I give this series a 4 based on my enjoyment of theshow.  Please continue to read to see a more detailed review.


Story:

The story was bland.  It's about a guy who got sucked into a magical past where people are given titles based on names from Norse mythology.  The story shows our main character, Suoo Yuuto winning wars using his smartphone to look up war tactics to beat his foes.  The other half of the show is him being fawned by his "sisters" and "daughters" who have sworn allegiance to him and love him unconditionally. 


However, this anime did get a proper ending unlike other Isekai anime that just leaves you behind and Yuuto did pick a girl.


Art:

Don't expect anything too much.  Colors and character designs are flat.  It is obvious that the studio didn't really give any care to this series.  Animation is minimal and usually depends on still pictures for battle scenes.  But even these still pictures are horribly drawn and laughable.


Sound:

I can't remember any of the OST that played in the show.  There are some cases where the volume of the music is raised and lowered based on the tension of the show.  By the way, there is no tension.  


Character:

To be frank, the characters are just a bunch of tropes.  Nothing that makes them too unique.  


Yuuto is the perfect selfless guy that has no defense against women.  His "sisters" and "daughters" love him because he is smart and kind.  The reason he rehects them is because he likes his childhood friend, which to be fair is something we haven't seen in a long time.


Defining each "sister" or "daughter" is pointless.  Every single of one of them wants his dick.  They each represent a trope: the erotic sister, the cool beauty, the imouto, the tomboy, and the three lolis. Most of them have little to no purpose in the story and are just there to state how great our main protagonist is.

I've never seen something so disgustingly bad, and that's coming from someone that somewhat enjoyed the other isekai anime this season. For starters, I'm not a huge fan of harems or fan service, but I can look past both if the story is good and the show has some substance. Sadly this does not, it's so incredibly boring and EXTREMELY awkward. The MC just comes across as some sick disgusting pervert, making anyone he defeats submit to him and either become his "child" or "sister." I would literally rather watch paint dry than watch another second of this crap. 
Let me serve as an examplefor you, don't waste your time with this crap.

I've seen my fair share of "bad" Isekai anime and found varying levels of enjoyment from them despite. BUT, this Isekai anime is appalling--it takes the cake for most painful Isekai anime to watch. 
To begin, this anime begins without a proper introduction and NEVER goes back to explain either. In fact, you must watch the opening song if you want to get even a hint of what occurs before episode 1. Its very confusing and the anime does nothing so far (as of episode 4) to properly explain the rules and intricacies of the world or how the protagonist got to where he is.

Everything that happens is just an excuse for the Protagonist to add to his harem to which he, of course, has no interest in because he cares more for some bland childhood friend girl that is not even around. 

There is absolutely no depth to the story or the characters. Everything is straightforward to a fault. As mentioned, everything is just about having some cute girls in an almost taboo type harem. 


This is an anime I was ready to drop before even finishing episode 1. And I probably should have, because the absolutely poor quality remains the same throughout. I say this as someone who has enjoyed some "terrible" Isekai animes. Don't waste your time with this anime.

This anime has been on my radar mostly because I kept coming back to the page to read the funny reviews about how bad it is, and I finally decided to watch it and write my own review.
This anime is bad. I think I have pretty low standards when it comes to anime, my average rating for all the anime I've logged on this website is an 8/10, but even after seeing the score for this and reading a lot of the reviews, this anime managed to limbo below my already low expectations, and then kick me in the shins for expecting more from it.
Anormal plot follows the path of exposition, rising action, climax, falling action, then resolution. The episodes don't follow this at all. Just considering the first episode, the plot went from climax to exposition to falling action then to rising action. It also doesn't help that the action scenes are tepid at best, and feel very short and rushed considering how major the consequences of the battles are supposed to be.


All the main characters the same generic anime faces, and the characters are so flat (with the exception of their tits) that hentai characters have more depth, and at least with hentai you'd see people fuck instead of this where the mc is one of those people who are probably afraid of kissing.


The second episode mentions that this is taking place two years after the mc came to this world, which to me just seems like an excuse so the writers don't have to write the probably more interesting story of what happened when he first landed in this world and why the girls already by his side like him. Probably because they can't think of a reason why the girls like him.


I don't think I've ever watched an anime where I've yelled 'what the fuck' and 'what is this shit' more times than this one.


Now that I think about it, the four sentence synopsis on this website explains more of the backstory than the first few episodes of the anime, and if I haven't read it then I would be completely lost.


I almost wish that this anime was worse than it is, because at least then it'd be so bad it's entertaining, like The Room, but no, this is just plain bad. Hell, if you're at least semi-amused from reading this then this review is more entertaining than the anime.


Characters are bland, story is okay but poorly executed, art is generic, skip this anime.

Why does this exist? I genuinely believe that the animators and the storywriters got bored and got a monkey high on LSD to copy and paste sections of other LNs to make this travesty. 
And boy does it copy other LNs liberally. The character is a clone of the guy from 'in another world with a smartphone'. The girls are copied from High School DxD and some of the lore gets thrown about casually too. The monkey took extra pains to make sure this was explained in one episode, but only so that it could confuse the viewer even more. The opponents are clones ofantagonists from 'Campione!'. 


The anime does not even try to follow the plot points to the end. Battles start without us knowing, and end off screen while the MC looks ahead with a constipated expression, moaning on about how he is just a cheat. The girls all 'love' him, but we see little reason why.  Really, they only serve to provide some fanservice. The MC spends a lot of time doing random things in the workshop and building his country, but we don't see the impacts of this. He mentions it once, it magically gets done and then we never hear of it again. 


The one noteworthy plot point is in relation to his girlfriend, which is followed through to the end. Although even here, the plot holes in between are greater than the sum total of their love story. We never get to know why this girl even loves this guy apart from her being his 'childhood friend'. Brilliant. Why bother building an actual relationship?


Even the final battle is skipped. I actually could not believe it. They skipped the final battle to show us a montage of the MC being cheered on by his people. 


This anime is trash. The animation is painfully average; the character design is uninspired and built on stereotypes of other, more popular characters; the plot is weak and nonsensical; the music is cringe-inducing; the dialogue is childish and the entire experience feels meaningless. There is no satisfaction at having followed one person or one clan through some defining struggle or overcoming massive odds or standing for the ideals. The anime never actually tries to make the viewer feel anything other than a vapid sense of the mind blanking out. There is no tragedy, no humour, no romance, nothing at all that can make the viewer interested. The only reason I watched this through to the end is because I have a soft spot for kingdom-building anime, manga or LNs. 


But this isn't it folks. This can legally be defined as an anime because of its origins, but as the bard said it best: To me, it is nothing more than a vacuum in the air.

The Master of Ragnarok & Blesser of Einherjar better known as Hyakuren no Haou to Seiyaku no Valkyria which is another version of a guy who goes to an alternative word and has use his wit in order to survive kind thing, but here the guy survived and for some obnoxious luck thrives and even become the big man in some kingdom know as the wolf clan, which btw was pretty much cliche since it coincides with another anime with a similar theme and you've guess it Isekai Maou to Shokan shoujo no Dorei Majitsu, so pretty much we have two such genres for thisseason alone, though how the characters were set and portrayed were different. Now I don't about you guys, in both scenarios they have females whom were utterly useless, here the maho shoujo was useless since we don't see her do any magical things in fact all that maho shojo does was to flirt around with the male character like a yes man,  there is a bokuko warrior who did even killed the hammer guy, we have a princess who wants to get laid but never got the chance , a boxum blacksmith who serves as added competition for the guy's harem and let's not forget the twin assassins whom were not there when they're needed. The only consolation here was for the guy to finally be with his love of his life and yes she becomes his wife in the alternate world.......Also, this anime was basically a dichotomy where at one point we see the deaths of soldiers dying and yet the hammer guy named Steinthor was only wounded by a katana wielding bokuko  Siegrune, where it would have been nice if he's dead and also seeing the guy going back to the alternate world and dragging someone else with him was basically a disappointment , since the ending would have been nice if the guy come home to his world and leaving Felicia in charge after things were already being set in peace. But it seems that original creator Takayama, Seiichi wants a garndious ending where the guy and his girl becomes royalty in an alternate world , so with nothing more to say , here are my ratings:


Story- Mediocre 5: It has the same genre and theme as that of another anime which was aired in the same season.  


Art-Mediocre 5:  Cu'z everything were just the usual.   


Sound- Mediocre 5: The inflections being used were to protary the character's voice were the usual.


Character-Pathetic 1: Since the guy  Suou, Yuuto was the quintessential stupid guy who wouldn't go for any of his harem girls, and them girls were seemly useless to begin with, basically they were just a bunch of eye candies.


Enjoyment-Patchetic 1: I really  hated the timing where the guy goes home in the mist of battle and the twins were nowhere to be found in order to kill that which Sigyn that would have guarantee a total victory and where the guy could go home to his world knowing that everything he left behind in the alternate world is in order, if only studio EMT² did that it would have been a good ending. 


Overall-Pathetic 1: It was just too much of a run of the mill fantasy and harem genre based anime.  BOOM!!!!! Mic drop.

I originally watched this because it has a ton of 1-star reviews, and I felt like watching something truly horrible and cringe-worthy!
Unfortunately that plan was foiled, because it's not half as bad as people say, just exceptionally mediocre and not really worth anyone's time. I didn't suffer too much watching it, but it's a certainty I won't remember a thing about it a week from now either.
I think it gets all those one star reviews because some people get pissed off by the fact anime studios get away with this level of uninspired mediocrity! But in reality, it's still competently made anime, and deserves asolid 5/10.


It doesn't deserve your attention though -  there are literally hundreds of better shows out there!


The Good:

Some of the girls don't follow the standard tropes entirely. They still aren't all that interesting, but sometimes mildly entertaining, and they're more or less likeable too. Yay.


The Bad:

They completely failed to do anything remotely interesting with the concept of having a character go back in time and be responsible for the formation of ancient myths.


The Ugly:

Thousands of nameless expendable men get slaughtered without anyone giving a shit. This show really underscores how little value our civilization ascribes to men who aren't "alpha".

It scratches the Isekai itch like a gas station satisfies my hunger for pizza.  It tastes bad, but still tastes like pizza so you eat it anyways.
There's not much more to say about it, but MAL want me to write a longer review. The relationship between the MC and his love interest is the highlight of the series, but it gets the least amount of time. Throw in a healthy amount of fan service and blah strategy war scenes, and that about sums it up.
That said, I still watched the whole thing and can't say I didn't like it, but this anime is trashand so am I.

Hyakuren no Haou to Seiyaku no Valkyria had a good concept for an isekai anime but was unfortunately rushed and cheated on by budget.
The pet peeves I had in this anime were: 
CGI budget cuts; Grandcrest Senki had budget cuts too but they tried to hide it really well. The Budget cuts I think also caused the mediocre ending.
Main character is weak asf, and does nothing besides google search strategies...
The antagonists were just flat characters.
The relationship the main character had with the girl back in Japan was a good excuse to not touch his harem (IMO more anime should do this excuse instead of makingthe main character a beta male) but their relationship was really bland and unrealistic.\n\n
This anime has an anime original ending, even changing the girl he ends up with.\n\n\n
Verdict: reboot this anime, this time with a good studio, the budget put into this show is not enough for a strategic/war anime.

Let me start off by saying of all the isekai anime I watched in my life, I’ve never been in any kind of pain until I watched this,Let me start with the MC. how do I describe him in one word? Annoying. There is something about the MC of this anime that I really hate, more than in any other isekai anime like kirito and someone else I forgot the name. 
There is not much to say about story art and sound so I’ll just move on to the characters. First thing we see from the anime Is a war and it said that thecharacter had been stuck in that world for quite a while now. so what? no background of the character of some sort.How did he become the patriarch? no explanation whatsoever, Girls are shit, They’re not even good considering this is an harem anime and the antagonist fucking piss me off, first of all he is stupid. I do not know why he’s made in the first place, I feel like they could have made someone a lot better than that piece of shit.\n\n
There are some moments (I guess) but it still bad quality for me, The character just uses strategies from the previous general through a fucking solar powered phone that can make a fucking call to the other world and can even surf the fucking net. By that I got more confused. To summarise it, I guess one of the shows at the bad end in the isekai genre.

LN reader here. I'd say that the Anime was just a mess. Its one of the cases where the source is decent yet the anime just does a bad job at adapting the source material. 
I'm one of the few who enjoyed the ride, but was majorly disappointed at how much they cut  content and world building (which the anime desperately needed). 
For a rookie director, I'd say he did a bad job at his first try. The anime is too rushed, cut out the lore, the worldbuilding, especially the much needed characterization for each of the characters. 
 Unlike how the romance wasportrayed in the anime, The source went the harem route.\n\n
Overall, this is just a badly adapted anime. I enjoyed it, but with how much content, world building, and lore they skipped throughout the show? I'll say it once again. The anime is just a mess.

Absolutely nothing about this show works. The characters are unfathomably stupid, the animation is that of something out a half melted flip book that’s been shoved up the ass of one of the awful CG horses the show insists on showing us at least twice and episode. I gonna start this review by saying "I FRICKING LOVE THIS SHOW!!!!!!!" for the same reasons that I love "Isekai wa Smartphone to Tomo ni" so much. The reasons being "IT"S PRETTY BAD" but it's "NOT BORING". 
     In this review, I gonna focus on a good part of the show because I don't see a point of taking this show seriously anyway. If you want to know about the in-dept analysis of the bad part then just read any reviews beside this one.
      I rate this anime 4.5/10 in termof quality but that number does not reflect my enjoyment of it because I do enjoy this anime a lot.


     Here's the reasons why.


     Hyakuren no Haou to Seiyaku no Valkyria is a generic-not so generic Isekai anime. Because most of the characters traits and settings is extremely generic but There's something interesting about it. 


     First is the main character "Yuuto". Who couldn't fight at all but he use his "solar power smartphone" to google things for his advantage via what I call a "Holy wifi hotspot" that sits in his throne room and his girlfriend's room(?) I guess..... 

And he isn't that dense so he's not irritates me like some other harem protagonist.


     Second is the art style. It's not what I would call good. 

But I do like some details in it ,like the fact that the infantry has decent looking helmets, shields ,spears equipped instead of some stupid "costume armor". Granted, It's not historically accurate but at least they try. The infantry even use sword as a sidearm instead of main weapon like some other show.


     Third is the characters has a proper goal. Yuuto wants to get back to his girlfriend. The girls want him. Again, It's not much but at least it's something.

The harem love him because in their point of views, he done a great favor for them and he is a brilliant mind. And he did express his feeling that he's only love his girlfriend.


    Finally, This anime "makes sense" of non sense in a way. For example, Yuuto said something like "The superpower in some people makes no goddamn sense." and other characters basically said "That's how it is, deal with it fam." (Obviously, This is not what they said but I can't be bother to check the actual script.) 

    And there's a scene when one of the main character use a katana cut right through a thick bronze dagger. Which seems to makes no sense but the katana's edge with hamon can be hardening up to 62+ HRC and bronze's edge can be harden up to around 44 HRC by hammering the edge. Normally you can't cut through that even with that different hardness but they establish that superpower did exist so it kinda makes sense? 


    Watching this anime is very entertaining despite it's obvious flaws. It's not as bad as "Isekai wa Smartphone to Tomo ni" but it's equally entertaining.


     I highly recommend this anime but please go into it with the same mindset like when you watching "The room (2003)" or "Shark Exorcist (2015)". This is not a good anime by any means but I'm sure you'll enjoy it with the a certain mindset.

Maybe consider drink 6 shots of vodka before watching it (If you not a minor of course).

So far, this show feels mediocre in every respect. And when you compare it to the currently airing Isekai shows like the third season of Overlord and How not to Summon a Demon Lord, it can barely hold a candle to them. It doesn't feel serious enough because of the bubbly harem and their trope personalities. It doesn't feel comedic enough because the main character is boring as all heck. It is stuck in a limbo between comedy and seriousness that just feels bad. One assumes that his phone is capable of charging via solar power but it is never stated; so as far asanyone is concerned, it never runs out of battery for plot convenience. So while the show isn't utterly terrible, at the moment I am only watching it to fill a bit of time while I wait for episodes of other airing shows.

First things first: turn your brain off to watch this.
And no, I don't mean in a digibro-overanalyzer way, just the critique part of the brain.
You don't need it here. You're here to watch funny shit. Here's some.
The scores above are not explanatory enough to define this anime so I will put some more here, also giving half points where necessary.
Plot: 8
Completeness: 5
Ecchi: almost non existent
Conclusion: 9
Art style: 7
CGI: 5
Sound: 6
Characters: 7
Enjoyment: 7.5
Overall: 7.5
Plot and completeness:
I didn't read the manga, but I feel an episode 1 is missing.
World building is rushed and some characters (Mizuki) are taken for granted.
The ending is a little short too, Ifeel there could've been an extra episode about the last episode's last minute.\n
Apart from that, assuming the manga has those parts, the plot is complete enough.\n
The events happening are what you expect from this type of story. Don't think too much about it.\n\n
As for the story itself, there's no lack of wholesomeness and the tropes are your typical isekai ones, and if you like isekais like me, you're set!\n\n
The ecchi!\n
Despite the anime being harem-ish, there's little to no ecchi, and literally only one scene on ep 10 could be un-cropped for a BD version. Apart from that maybe two minute of baths with towels on and not much convenient censoring. Apart from one washing scene all of it is fairly innocent and not lewd.\n
And all the girls' feelings are genuine and there's close to no unneeded "lewd for the sake of it", you can literally feel the affection over the fanservice.\n
Surprisingly refreshing considering the genre.\n\n
Also MC is consistently being faithful to his love interest(s) without acting clueless/dense around any of the girls more than necessary, and after that, the relationship progress is not lost. You know, that good trait, of not being a cardboard (that people hate a lot on characters like Kirito, for example). More harem anime need a MC like this one.\n\n
Conclusion:\n
Not spoiling.\n
It's not open nor unsatisfying in any way.\n
(other than making you want an extra episode with last minute's contents that is)\n\n
Art style and CGI:\n
The art stile is average, but it's generally good looking and the quality remains consistent throughout the story.\n
There's a fairly high use of CGI, especially for armies, chariots and arrows. Some is almost undistinguishable, some are a little less well done, but there's no crap one. In this regard this anime did better than a lot of "good" anime that instead make use of occasional low budget garbage CGI for some scenes (ex. Lancer in some scenes of the Fate HF Movie I), if not consistently using it for stuff in background (ex. Girls' Last Tour).\n
So overall not appalling CGI, mostly decent, but used a little too often than necessary.\n\n
Sound:\n
The music wasn't bad, but I can't remember any tune I heard during the anime after watching it.\n
So decent but not memorable. 6/10 for me.\n\n
Characters:\n
Nothing out of ordinary.\n
There are stereotypes, but the characters are not flat as cardboard.\n
Except maybe some specific ones that suffered the lack of a first episode with world building.\n\n
Enjoyment and overall score\n
In the end despite the plot lacking complexity, it was a good ride, and left me satisfied with the ending, and no need for a season two.\n\n

The only reason I'm writing this review is to simply try and get others to understand this anime. Simply put this isn't an anime you watch seriously or with the idea that it can be a master piece. This is an anime that you can turn your brain off and enjoy without serious thinking or need to actually remember everything from the beginning.
A lot of people draw comparisons to In Another World With My Smartphone, as someone who hasn't seen this I feel like I enjoyed this anime more then other people. Now yes there is some inconsistencies with the show but it was adecent show.


I prefer Ecchi anime mostly, Harem not so much as it can really detract from the show. With that said some of the scenes are a bit off putting but all in all a lot of them were pretty funny if you don't think of them as sexy scenes and more as Ecchi. Again I would mention trying not to think to hard during this anime as you ruin things more often then not rather then just enjoying the humor of the show.


I would say it's not a very good story as the pacing was a little weird and the way it ends is just of putting at best, due to it not having a second season. It was good to watch if you don't have anything to watch and enjoy Ecchi other then that I really can't see why you would like this anime.


Final thought most of the backlash this anime gets is from being bland, which in the case of the story I can kinda understand. With that in mind it's not completely terrible I personally want to see a second season due to the idea of Norse Mythology and the humor of the show. Seeing the poor reviews makes that near impossible, mostly because they don't like the type of anime be it Ecchi/Harem or Isekai.

This is my first anime review, and is most likely going to be my last. I want to review this for the people who watch anime (like me) as a form of mindless entertainment rather than for intellectual stimulation.
I thoroughly enjoy certain anime with very little plot elements and or character development, if you don't believe me just look at my anime list and cringe in disapproval.  But this anime is quickly becoming the least enjoyable form of entertainment that I have seen in a near decade despite my tastes.
This anime has one dimensional characters. A setting that is completely devoid of any realism,and an unholy cookie cutter MC who's as dumb as a brick. Usually I wouldn't mind any of that, but this anime takes it to a point where it's hard to enjoy. It's literally waifubait. I don't know if that's a slang word in this community, but I'm using it. This anime is strictly for people who like "pretty anime girls" with absolutely no redeeming factors other than their attractiveness. 


What am I talking about? Well, lets delve into this roller coaster of a dumpster fire. I don't want to waste to much of my time so I'm just going to point out certain points that make me face palm. Well, the entire anime makes me face palm so I'm just going to go over two major points that are pretty ridiculous to me.


1.  The first thing that caught me off guard in episode one when the council came to a rather reasonable conclusion to NOT help the horn clan during an invasion.


They had just conquered the horn clan after a WAR mind you, and created an oath. Now, in the story the horn and wolf clans had a history of hostility; and it wasn't until recently when Mr. Iamaniceguy took over and was able to overthrow the horn clan winning the back and forth war. 


During a council meeting it was reveled that the horn clan was going to be invaded by around ten thousand troops. The council members casually talk about how even though an oath was in place it shouldn't matter if they [wolf clan] didn't help, meaning that it wasn't a big deal. 


In any normal situation someone would observe their reactions and try to convince the council to change their minds to increase their charisma further within the wolf clan in order to prevent a Judas and Jesus situation, or something similar. However this idiot throws a tantrum and simply states that it would "ruin" the reputation of the wolf clan. 


Now I could write a short story or a full length novel on why his little tantrum was immature and idiotic, but I want to keep this review brief and just state that any reasonable human being would understand why the "council" or any of the wolf clan would be reluctant to help the horn clan and try to reason with them in order to set an example and prove himself further within the clan. There's is a myriad of other political reasons why it is idiotic to do what he did, but I think I have made my point. I also want to state that his outburst could have been used as a plot elements to have an enemy within the wolf clan to put more depth into the story. But you know, na.


2. Having no explanation at all for the setting and completely ignoring basic storytelling rules.


Okay, so we are eight episodes into this garbage fire and we have no idea why the MC is where he is, and or why he has a smartphone with service. Instead of treating it like a major plot element they throw it under the rug. The MC has NO urgency to return, nor does he act like he cares at all about the person he "loves". 


This idiot is so one dimensional that nothing has ever fazed him besides the "oh no! Hot girl is naked in front me" trope, or something similar. His only concerns throughout the anime involve the waifubots with almost no personality that surround him. Think of a harem/comedy main character that you like, now strip him from any enjoyable traits and you get the MC. He's so daft and uninteresting that it's almost hard to explain. Putting it in words I would say that I wouldn't care if he died. If he was killed in the anime it wouldn't affect me at all.


end of review 3/10. I give it a three because of the waifus. 


(God help me, while writing this review I thought of so many things that have urked me about this anime, and it's like a bottomless pit of bad. Stay away at all costs, only watch if you enjoy attractive anime girls, because that's all it has.)

Show Summary 
Hyakuren no Haou to Seiyaku no Valkyria, is a show that tries to combine many aspect to create a rather serious environment, in a world filled with warfare, politics and next gen wincestry. Whilst it tries to cover a broad aspect it doesn't manage to exactly handle one of them correctly except perhaps the battles which is also pushing it to say that. The show tries to implement a serious tones in certain situation but always falls completely flat due to the scenarios it's used in are either don't have any logic to support them or is completely forced BS from hell. 
MoreThoughts\n
Firstly you're thrown into the story with a time skip and i suppose that's fine if it's further broken down in later episodes that could tie into a mystery unveiling.\n
The pacing of the story is atrocious with character development being one of the worst i have ever seen. The instances go from 0 - 100 within an episode or two and you're left wondering what the hell is happening. The story attempts to be emotional but fails at every point due to the characters reasoning being either utterly stupid or comes off really dull.\n
The first episode had me intrigued in what the series had to offer and it's the episode i can say was good but from there one it's one massive downhill spiral.\n\n\n
Should you watch it ?\n
No unless you're masochist who enjoys the pain <3

The isekai genre is something of a guilty pleasure of mine. When I was a kid one of my favorite books was A Connecticut Yankee in King Arthur's Court - a trope-defining book written by Mark Twain over 100 years ago which still stands as an American literary classic. It's been adapted & used as the inspiration for dozens of books, cartoons, TV shows, motion pictures, and it could even be argued that it was the precursor to the entire genre in anime today. Based on the descriptions I'd heard of this anime -I- thought this is what I was in for. I could nothave been more wrong.


Some of the most interesting concepts of the book: bringing civilization to the "uncivilized" & what would happen if the technological advancements mankind has achieved throughout history had been introduced sooner - are essentially glossed over and not even REMOTELY utilized to their full effect. Instead we get kids & teenagers (who for SOME reason seem to rule every country) drug into this weird incestuous fantasy alliance/cult where all their adult citizenry seem to think this is perfectly normal.


Put aside the fact that we have no idea how he managed to get to this world/point in time, put aside his magical mary-sue solar powered time/space negating smartphone, put aside the isekei & harem tropes, and it's STILL a horrible anime. Bad writing, 1D characters, and a gajillion different bland cultures in a gajillion bland interchangable nation states. I watched 3 or 4 episodes of this and still didn't care one whit about any of the characters. Boring & cringe-worthy are the nicest descriptors I can think of for this show.


Do yourself a favor and don't waste your time. Or watch as much of it as you can stomach and tell me how you managed not to indulge in the fantasy of punching the writer in his junk.

Oh wait wow can someone just give this anime a first season? get it? ugh
So what's actually wrong with this anime? two problem.
1. Feels like you're watching a second season of something without ANY background information.
2. Ending is poorly done (too loose and rushed like they don't even care about this anime and let's just throw something to end it, no? hah)
The whole different universe or "isekai" theme started rising since the hype of NGNL and Re:zero. However, as you would've known, there's almost none that could actually pull a decent one let alone become a hype. Right now the theme "isekai" itself have abad reputation due to a lot of anime failing at this theme. And as you would've guess, this is one of them. The reputation is already bad enough to make us lose interest, but I wasn't expecting the anime itself to have a problem.\n\n
First of all, you're thrown into a world where- wait whaaat no this story doesn't start from there it starts after that. And when I say after I mean WAY after that. And when does the anime fills us about it? Never. They never did any proper introduction. There was a brief flashback of explaining but it still doesn't fill us in completely. All we know that the mc is right now at the top of the command and with only that information we're expected to enjoy the show. Yeah we can do that right? no, just no hell no.\n\n
The starting itself was already bad as it is, but it gets worse. Why? Because it's rushed, the whole plot felt so light that it doesn't have any impact whatsoever, and suddenly we're over with it. Not to mention the way that they pull of the ending just proves to us how little they value this anime, at least that is what I conclude after finishing this anime.\n\n
To wrap it up, is this an anime that is worth to watch? My answer is definitely no. This anime will only make you hate the theme "isekai" more and if you're a fan of this theme like me, it would be wise to just stay away from animes that make the reputation of the theme "isekai" worse like this.

I really  wanted to like this anime, i really did.  I love anime with the isekai premise. But this was just appalling. To summarize this anime I would give you this. Take a story, make a 50 episode series out of it. Now cut it down to 24 episodes. Now cut out the first 12 episodes. Then air the remaining 13-24 episodes. Now you have Hyakuren no Haou.
I was confused on the first episode. After the 4th i started to kinda get it. But I really wanted the back story. They keep hinting on things that happened in the past and that seemsway more interesting than what is currently happening in the story.\n\n
In other isekai type anime  the first episode shows the character being drawn into the world and after that shows his struggles adapting and proving himself to his new allies. This anime starts you in the middle of a battle with his allies already loving him and goes from there. Nothing really changes in the story. It is really blah. I really wanted to like this, i really did. But they tore out all the things that makes this genre awesome and left us with the scraps.

You know those animes that are "so bad it's good" and then those ones that are "so bad it's bad" right? Yeah well this one is one of the "so bad that it's funny how bad it is" animes. I mean at least the story exists and it's not hard to follow what's going on. I can't really say much because there's not much to say about it. It's bad I guess, but it's bad in a funny kind of way? I don't know, I just think that you should ignore the reviews and watch it yourself to see what you think of it, butI mean don't go past episode 3 if you don't like it. At least Yuuto doesn't even participate in combat until episode 11, showing that he isn't Kirito levels of OP because he's not even good at sword fights. Also what's with the solar powered smartphone? Never heard of those before watching the anime. All in all, just a funny anime to watch because of how little they cared about it when making the anime

This show has basically taken the worst of the things from the isekai genre and combined them together very poorly. The characters feel very generic, even for this type of show, the action is boring, the visuals are lacking and the sound design and voice acting are not the best.
The only thing that I've found even remotely enjoyable about this show was the outro music because I couldn't wait for the episodes to end.
I don't know how I made it this far without having convulsions of the amount of cringe that I've witnessed. I do feel a little bit emotionally scarred tho. 
Don't watch this,and if you made it to episode 3 or 4, believe me, it won't get better, it will only get worse.\n\n
If you want to watch something that is actually good this season, then watch Demon Lord from another world or if you are into the classics Twelve kingdoms, believe me, it's good.

It is your not so typical Isekai Anime/Manga/Novel
since most of the Isekais MC's are more on fighting than strategizing.
You could say it is bad "SINCE" unlike other Isekais, it didn't show how did
the MC ended up there. Second reason, the genre or/and the setting is outdated I mean, nowadays we know that this kind of mangas will either contain Mythical creatures or the almost mentioned OP metal the "Adamantite".
This one wouldn't have been bad "IF ONLY" this was released a 5-10 years ago.
The choice of using weapons in the "Norse Mythology" as buffs or the so-called "runes"(watch it so that you could know more). Isgood since it is unique but it is 2018 and the genre is outdated but if that thing isn't considered... Man. this is so good.\n\n
Oh well, its just my review and I have read the Light Novel + I haven't watched all the latest episodes. Thus, it's all up to you... ALL UP TO YOUUUUUUU (AIR SUPPLY) MAH BOI.\n\n
8/10 is my first impression :)

This anime has no actual plot. They just told us a summary of what happened when the main character first came to the other world. It seemed more like a second season of the show. The war between the clans was trash, in the first episode that wasn’t even close to a phalanx, there just some troops running in the battle, not even close to the real thing. 
The art isn’t that bad, it’s just mediocre, but that doesn’t make the show any better. 
The characters are generic. The main character like any other in a harem show that gets all the girls. 
If youhaven’t understand already I didn’t enjoy a minute of this anime, it was boring seeing all the cliche scenes again and again. \n
Overall I give it an 1/10 and I don’t recommend it
